main.name: Tim Baker
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.

resume.skillmessage: Some of the most Used Languages and Frameworks used by me for Test Automatization

education.description:
Learned about and perform system, acceptance, regression, load and
functional/performance testing on applications using both automated and manual
testing methods. Validate, verify, communicate, and resolve software issues through
careful, thoroughly documented testing to maximize return

education.school:
III High School in Sopot Class with Mathematics
and Informatics profile

work.title: Senior Software Test Automation Engineer
work.description:
#Project for Client – big website for sports betting
• Defining Test strategy
• Development of automation test frameworks (Technologies: Java,
Selenium Web Driver, Junit, Cucumber, JavaScript, CodeceptJS, Pupeteer,
Allure, AssertJ, RestAssured, BrowserStack, Jenkins, Maven, Git,
Kubernetes, Docker)
• Created client for JS based test Automation frameworks for reporting test
execution in ReqTest
• Monitoring and scaling the services according to traffic
• Working closely with Client
• Ensuring the timely delivery of different testing milestones
• Mentoring for new employees, task planning for trainees
• Web and Mobile application functional testing
• Creating documentation
• Participating in process of identifying and choosing test reporting tool
• Preparing bug reports
 #EPAM inside projects:
• Participating in technical interviews with candidates and being expert in
assessment committee
• Technical Mentor for mentees
• Lecturer in QA Academy program for new Test Automation Engineers

work.title: Lecturer
work.description:
Giving lectures about manual and automation tests approaches, Test Management,
Basics of programming in Java, Automation testing (BDD, TDD, Design Patterns,
Automation test best practices), Test frameworks (Selenium Web Driver, BDD with
Cucumber)

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
